name: Proklyatyye
startIntroPart1: Perhaps it would have been better if man had never split the atom. If only we could go back and make it so no one could harness nuclear energy... Maybe then, we would never have burned the world to the ground. Maybe then you would not feel the sickness in your bones. But all that is in the past. We have to live with it now, no? But here is our secret: we can live with it, and they cannot. They have no stomach for radiation. And so this curse upon the land is a blessing to us. The sickness goes before us and destroys our enemies, leaving only us alive. That is not so bad now, is it?
startIntroPart2: This sick and dying world is our birthright. Let us go and claim it all for ourselves, and see if we cannot make a heaven out of this hell.
declaringWar: Your lands look fertile. We'll take them.
attacked: So you think you can destroy us? Let us see if our sickness can destroy you first!
defeated: Just promise me that you will try to heal this dying world.
introduction: Hello, stranger! I would shake your hand, but it is better if you do not touch me.
tradeRequest: How would you like it if I propose this kind of exchange?
uniques: [+10]% Strength <for [All] units> <when fighting in [Toxic Waste] tiles>

name: The Harbingers
startIntroPart1: The years before the Cataclysm were worse than the survivors realize. Humanity came dangerously close to being permanently enslaved by a handful of oligarchs. Some of our ancestors were among those evil elite, and even among that group they wielded exceptional power, having devised a means to control our planet's dwindling water supply. Anyone who dared to oppose them had their minds reformatted... or worse. Now we are left to handle the fallout from their actions. Shunned by the rest of the world, atonement for many of us may simply be a matter of practicality, but we must at least try to atone regardless, and use our resources for the benefit of man as we should have done in the last days of our former civilization.
startIntroPart2: We were Harbingers of the old world's downfall. Perhaps, given the chance, we might set things right, becoming Harbingers of man's triumph and ushering in a new, better world.
declaringWar: You have demonstrated that you cannot be trusted to maintain control over your precious resources.
attacked: You desire control over our water as we once desired control over yours. Very well. Let us remind you why we are known as the Harbingers.
defeated: On this day, we pay in full the price of our corporation's sins...
introduction: We know you are displeased to see us. An understandable reaction given our past history.
hateHello: You tempt us to revert to old practices in our dealings with you.
uniques: [+50]% Production when constructing [Gold] buildings [in all cities]
[Gold] cost of purchasing items in cities [-20]%
[-33]% Production when constructing [Military] units [in all cities]
[-67]% Gold from Great Merchant trade missions
[+100]% unhappiness from the number of cities

civilopediaText.text: The years before the Cataclysm were worse than the survivors realize. Humanity came dangerously close to being permanently enslaved by a handful of oligarchs. Some of our ancestors were among those evil elite, and even among that group they wielded exceptional power, having devised a means to control our planet's dwindling water supply. Anyone who dared to oppose them had their minds reformatted... or worse. Now we are left to handle the fallout from their actions. Shunned by the rest of the world, atonement for many of us may simply be a matter of practicality, but we must at least try to atone regardless, and use our resources for the benefit of man as we should have done in the last days of our former civilization.
We were Harbingers of the old world's downfall. Perhaps, given the chance, we might set things right, becoming Harbingers of man's triumph and ushering in a new, better world.

name: Crimson Line
declaringWar: It's time to liberate your stations and integrate them into the Line!
attacked: Only a fool with a death wish would jump into the path of a train.
defeated: It looks like the end of the line...
introduction: I am General Secretary Moskvin of the Crimson Line, and I'm overjoyed to meet a fellow survivor of the Cataclysm. I believe there is much we have to offer one another.
hateHello: Save your words. You are but another ghost who doesn't realize he is dead.
afterPeace: It was a fight over nothing. Let's settle it with a drink.
tradeRequest: Shall we come to an arrangement in the pursuit of solidarity?
uniqueName: One Party, One Leader, One Ideology
uniques: Each city founded increases culture cost of policies [17]% less than normal
[+15]% [Production] [in all cities] <for [10] turns> <upon declaring war with a major Civilization>
